conclusion: Understand how position and size of shadows change when light source moves backward.
Objects are illuminated by a light source casting shadows on the ground.
Analyze shadows and their relation to objects' positions.
Objects above slabs are a glove, a calendar, a hat, and a peach.
Light source is positioned above the objects.
Shadows will change in size and position when light source moves backward.
Objects are positioned above the slabs.
Light source is currently positioned above the objects.
Shadows will shift in position; move downward and to the right.
Size of shadows will decrease as light source moves backward.
Objects will appear smaller and move to the right as light source moves backward.
A decreases in size, B moves to the right, C moves downward, D moves to the left.
